Message.Title: My tenant works at AMAZON HQ, struggling to pay the rent
Message.Msg: My tenant has a 6 month contract at Amazon HQ in Europe. Needs to ask his brother to chip in for the rent. He earns minimum wage plus food vouchers, and works 10+ hours a day. I believe that amazon is like a big supermarket, and the margins are low. Unless they can increase margins significantly; the stock is pretty overvalued. I dont think it will go under, they are good at keeping costs low, but, i think growth will slow down, and competition comes from people selling books directly on pdf format or whatever.

Topic.Title: How Will Amazon Ever Make Money???

Message.Msg: Now that we know a little more California, we don't have someone as public as Carl Icahn here who will be selling the day after earnings but I still think the results won't be good here on an apples to apples revenue basis and guidance I'm not so sure about but things are slowing here. They want to run this up into earnings and I plan on shorting more after hours. I got extremely lucky on NFLX last night. I'm trying to stay away for options with lots of premium so I shorted some shares late yesterday and an equal amount in after hours at 393. I was actually trying to cover those last night but my price never hit and even this morning I had a trade that should have went off but DID NOT. Someone did me a solid BIG TIME.

Topic.Title: How Will Amazon Ever Make Money???

Message.Msg: hapihammer: glad to hear your story. Very well stated. The thing with AMZN dynamics at this juncture is this: If AMZN declares losses again, it will be status quo, as in the last 5 years and the pps will zoom up to 375 in a heart bit! But, God forbid, and if AMZN declares a profit some day, the stock will instantly loose 25%... such is the convoluted-state of affairs here now. Many parties are involved, many parties interests are inter-tangled at this juncture here ... so, AMZN will declare another loss and the pps will zoom-up again IMHO! Extremely counter-intuitive I know, but that's what has been working here for last 20 quarters! If you like this post, please reco it! Thanks.

Topic.Title: Barrons article this week--"show me the money (profits)"

Message.Msg: Tried to post earlier. It's nice to see a start, but the real question is whether any analysts will actually probe, especially in light of changes in accounting treatment. Any analyst not demanding a YOY adjusted for accounting treatment is both incompetent and negligent.

Topic.Title: Barrons article this week--"show me the money (profits)"

Message.Msg: I can't see how hey can pull off a good quarter. Practically every retailer has reported bad earnings, Best Buy seems to be catching up in the electronics side, NFLX is eating their lunch in streaming, and their tablets seem to be inferior to competitors. Compound that with terrible consumer confidence, government shutdown fears, and a very weak consumer. I know earnings hasn't matter in Helicopter Ben's economy, but it appears the Q/E simply isn't working. With that said this fraud will go up on poor numbers and disappointing guidance.
